#summary M1 version FAQ.

= Introduction =

These are commonly encountered questions regarding the M1 version of GWT-Maven. 


= Details =

*Q) How should I setup machine/platform specific properties for M1? 

Use a "build.properties" file which specifies the location of "maven.googlewebtoolkit-home" and the value of "platform".  Then use "platform" in your POM to define gwt-dev-platform, if needed for your project.  

Also IF you are using a Mac you must pass -XstartOnFirstThread to the JVM for GWT usage. 
To do this edit your build.properties file and add "-XstartOnFirstThread" 
with the "google.webtoolkit.extrajvmargs" AND "maven.junit.jvmargs" properties.

*build.properties example*
{{{
# maven build properties (goes in ~/.maven)
platform=[mac|windows|linux]
maven.googlewebtoolkit.home=[PATH]/gwt-[mac|windows|linux]-1.4.60
# uncomment the next two properties for GWT-Maven usage on the Mac
#google.webtoolkit.extrajvmargs=-XstartOnFirstThread
#maven.junit.jvmargs=-XstartOnFirstThread -Dgwt.coverage.enable=true

}}}

*gwt-dev-platform dependency example*
{{{
<!-- ~/build.properties must have maven.googlewebtoolkit.home and platform defined  -->
<dependency>
  <groupId>com.google.gwt</groupId>
  <artifactId>gwt-dev-platform</artifactId>
</dependency>
}}}
